column4: hi i've just upgraded from dapper to edgy, and i'm having trouble with the kernel. it is still the same from dapper.. it diidn't upgrade the kernel what could be wrong?? any pointers or any package i must install again??? Thanks
very odd.  You didn't have any issues with update-manager?
humm it ask 2 or 3 times if i wanted to overwrite some files, but nothing related to kernel, only bluetooth and things like that... i've choosen to rewrite everything.
odd.  Well, hmm.  pastebin your sources.list, just to make sure.
to make sure nothing is abnormal, then yeah, we'll do some manual upgrades/installations
this is my sources.list , dapper repos are commented out http://pastebin.ca/423168
do you think i must fill a bug, or search for something similar previously reported???
Odd.  Well, do this `sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade`  see what it wants to upgrade
this is what it wants to upgrade http://pastebin.ca/423175 .. no kernel
hmmm seems that is not there dpkg -l | grep linux-image-686 .. root@dieguito:/etc/apt #
eh?  Why are you using root?  Anwyay.  That's your issue.  You haven't gotten kernel updates in quite a while actually.  For edgy, install linux-image-generic
you should probably file a bug against update-manager, mentioning that it doesn't automatically check for a kernel metapackage
